stepresult.p: By default, the Open page appears.

step.cmd: In the Open page, select , and then select User Defined Event.
step.stepresult: The Add User Defined Event window appears, displaying a list of user-defined Autolog sheets accessible to the logged-in user as configured in the Plant Applications Administrator.

step.cmd: In the 1. Choose activity section, select an activity to create a user-defined event on the selected activity.
In the 2. Add Event Details section, in the EVENT NUMBER box, enter an event number that is unique and not already added to the database.
In the DURATION box, select a start and end time for the production-based event.

info.note: The start and end time of the event must be within two hours from the current date and time.

step.cmd: Specify values for the following optional properties: STATUS, APPLIED PRODUCT, and COMMENT.

info.note: When the status of a user-defined event associated with the activity is set to a production status that has the Lock Event Data option enabled, you do not have the privilege to modify the Autolog sheet for that event.

step.cmd: In the REASONS box, select a reason to create a user-defined event.

taskbody.result: The user-defined event for the selected activity is added and an activity is automatically created for the event. The activity appears in the Open page.
